main event: Observers watched a very bright orange-red object in the eastern part of the sky moving up and down for approximately 3 hours.
interesting points: The object changed its elevation rapidly and finally disappeared from sight,The evaluation of the sighting is inconclusive due to insufficient data,The object was reported to be brighter than the brightest stars,The observer described the object as having a color of very bright orange-red,The observation lasted for about 3 hours but the exact nature and origin of the object remain undetermined.
witness description: A 13-year-old male who observed the object with others at home
